intro: Oreoxis trotteri, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a low-growing habit with linear leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Oreoxis trotteri is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
